title: Once again, how did i not get an S
body:
Ok, the first time you guys told me my farm was shit. So i worked extra hard to farm up this game. Pls tell me how i fucked up this time
https://s9.postimg.org/6iymeyrbj/twitch_s.png

replies.body: Farm still isn't good enough. You're at 3.75/minute. Not counting cannon/siege minions, there's 12 minions per minute per lane; you're getting less than a third of them.
That is jungle Twitch tho. My guess is either low team participation (only 2 assists) or damage may be low. Objectives also factor in the jungle, but idk how many dragons/barons Twitch got.
Ah, missed that little detail. That does explain it some, but by 40 minutes he should still have cleared 200 cs at minimum, due to being a marksman.
As I have seen from others you want to aim for 75 cs per 10 min of the game so in a 30-40 min game you are looking at 225-300 cs. It's not a guarantee but it is a trend noticed by many.
In addition to this, I think it's because you only have 2 assists. Now, I'm not 100% positive about this, but I think your assists also have something to do with it.

From what I have gathered from other posts there are a few things to consider for your grade. 

1.  CS (top, mid, and adc look for 75 per 10 min) 

2. K/D/A as a whole (different weights on kills+assists)

3.  Objective participation. Dragon, towers, and Baron

4.  Wards placed. The support is not the only person responsible for vision. 

5.  Character/lane. Your performance is compared to that of others in the position you are playing them. (no idea how this is measured determined etc just another point I have heard)
I just read a similar thread and someone commented it also has something to do with your overall damage dealt.
The biggest problem I see is 37% kill participation.  While that fairly high for this particular game, that is extremely low for a normal S rank game.

Perfect cs by 38:40 is 477. You're below 33%.
Also, are you warding a lot? Are you getting kills in other lanes? Are you getting enough objective contribution?

Ok, I'm sorry if I get a little bit ranty, but can we stop with this fucking ideology of "perfect cs"? The only way I could've gotten that much cs by then was camp the fucking jungle all game and do nothing but farm.

> [{quoted}](name=Tazret,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=vAToV9NB,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-08-09T23:34:17.164+0000)
>
> Ok, I'm sorry if I get a little bit ranty, but can we stop with this fucking ideology of "perfect cs"? The only way I could've gotten that much cs by then was camp the fucking jungle all game and do nothing but farm.

I don't want you to get perfect cs, but I think it's reasonable to try and get 50% or so if you want a S grade.

It's unfortunate that Riot won't tell us exactly what requirements need to be met in order to get an S+, S, S-. I heard it's because then people will only play a certain way in order to meet those requirements, but at the end of the day, you have to play well to get one of those ranks but aren't most people playing because they want to do well already? I would certainly like some clarity on what the formula is for this because I'm a support main and one time I went 1/0/22 and I only got an A+. Someone even said that's literally what a sup should be doing. So how do I only get A+? I don't understand it, but whatever.
